10.19.text:
This may look like a plain, unassuming piece
of parchment, but it's actually one of the

15.34.text:
most famous documents in the world. Magna
Carta, meaning 'the Great Charter', has

22.36.text:
inspired people across the centuries, from
Thomas Jefferson to Mahatma Gandhi. But why

28.57.text:
was the charter originally created? And what
does it actually say?

33.10.text:
Let us take you back to medieval England.
It's the year 1215, and the ruler is King

40.07.text:
John. Many people believe that King John was
one of the worst kings in history. He imprisoned

47.39.text:
his former wife; he starved his opponents
to death; he allegedly murdered his own nephew,

53.65.text: and pulled the beards of the Irish Chiefs.

57.55.text:
King John had imposed heavy taxes on his barons
in order to pay for his expensive foreign

63.78.text:
wars. If they refused to pay, he punished
them severely or seized their property. The

70.53.text:
barons demanded that King John obey the law;
when he refused, they captured London and

80.72.text:
The two sides met at Runnymede in June 1215.
The result of the negotiations was written

87.94.text:
down by the king's clerks in the document
we know as Magna Carta. Although most of the

95.87.text:
charter's clauses dealt with medieval rights
and customs, Magna Carta has become a powerful

101.22.text: symbol of liberty around the world.

105.17.text:
The most famous clause, which is still part
of the law today, for the first time gave

110.32.text:
all 'free men' the right to justice and
a fair trial.

114.75.text:
'No man shall be arrested or imprisoned
except by the judgment of their equals and

120.93.text:
by the law of the land. To no one will we
sell, to no one deny or delay right or justice.'

124.93.text:
However, this clause was not as liberal at
it sounds. The Charter only applied to 'free

130.01.text:
men', the vast majority of people in 1215
were unfree peasants who were ruled over by

137.79.text:
And although, Magna Carta was intended to
create peace between King John and his rebellious

144.14.text:
barons, England was plunged into civil war
after the Pope declared the Charter invalid.

151.06.text:
When King John died of dysentery in 1216,
nine year old Henry III took to the throne.

158.52.text:
To keep the peace, Magna Carta was reissued
several times during the 13th century, until

165.42.text: it was finally made part of English law.

169.62.text:
Magna Carta has lived on for 800 years, and
is echoed in the United States Declaration

176.54.text:
of Independence and the Universal Declaration
of Human Rights.Perhaps Magna Carta's most

183.62.text:
important legacy is that everyone - including
our leaders - must obey the law.

190.40.text:
What started out as a document of specific
complaints from a group of barons has turned

196.14.text:
into an international symbol of liberty, without
which we might not have the rights we value
